original_title: Sri Lanka revises down price of widely used petrol, diesel
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka state run Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) reduced the price of most mostly used fuel products, effective from November 30 midnight, but raised the price of premium products.

Price of mostly used petrol Octane 92 was reduced by 10 rupees to 346 rupees a litre, Auto Diesel price was slashed by 27 rupees to 329 rupees per litre, and the price of kerosene was raised by 2 rupees to 247 rupees, the Ceypetco said.
However, the price of Octane 95 was raised by 3 rupees to 426 rupees and Super Diesel was increased by 3 rupees to 434 rupees.
Lanka IOC, the sole subsidiary of state-owned Indian Oil Corporation and Sinopec also revised the prices in line with the prices of Ceypetco.

Fuel prices, however, are likely to see an increase in January when the government impose 18 percent tax on fuel for the first time to boost the state revenue, analysts have said. (Colombo/Nov 30/2023)
